title: MEDICAL Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: lab-related questions, experience-related questions, and some scenario questions to see whether you can handle it and work efficiently in the lab. they prefer experienced employees as well as new fish but have the passion to learn
Interview Questions: list three reasons why the sample is rejected

title: Talent Acquisition Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital
Interview Descriptions: One interview with senior team member and manager, Teams video call, 1 hour long, explain work history, ideas to improve team/processes, situational questions surrounding workload and how to prioritize - friendly, approachable process
Interview Questions: What ideas do you have to improve process and how to you use data to help

title: Clinical Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Applied on the website. Got an email a week later inviting me to interview. 1hr interview. 3 interviewers, 7 minutes with each person, then someone goes over the position details at the end
Interview Questions: - What is mission and vision of the Ottawa Hospital - What are the core values - Are you a team player - What would previous employers say about your work ethic/style

title: Senior Research Associate - Bioinformatics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I talked on zoom to the two lab directors - MD doctors/scientists. Nice people. We discussed research in their labs and how work is organized. We spoke for an hour.
Interview Questions: Did I work with Single Cell data?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions:
3 hiring panels interviewed me for the RN position at the Ottawa Hospital. 
First question is about how to care a patient with IFC with UTI.
How will you manage a patient with dementia.
If you are not sure about a procedure, what will you do?
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Attendant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: you will be interviewed by 9 panelist. when the interview is done you will received an email about putting your reference. make sure the person you put on the reference will respond to the question.
Interview Questions: characteristics of a high performing team

title: Technical Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Process was okayish, many situational questions were asked which required depth learning. Overall it was a neutral process for an entry level role. Technical questions weren't asked much as it was entry level role.
Interview Questions: About technical knowledge and interest in this role.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Two initial screening calls with Human Resources written assessment needed to be submitted, one formal interview with Hiring Manager with a panel and one more follow up call with Hiring Manager and their manager..
Interview Questions: The formal interview focused on supervisory skills and experience using scenarios.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital
Interview Descriptions: There was a group interview, and the interviewers made the process comfortable. There were multiple presentations that had to be attended before starting. You also have to make sure you have all the vaccinations.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to volunteer here?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: You will start with  ag group interview: where the process of the interview will be explain to you. Then 1:1 interview which is divided into 5 station and then a conclusion: where everyone come together.
Interview Questions:
Know the Values of TOH
Post and after seizures precaution
UTI

title: Project and Admin Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward and asked for details about previous experience and how it would help in this position that I was interviewing for. Be confident and kind and educated. That's what the process was like.
Interview Questions: What do you think your experience in ___ position will help you in this one?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very simple. The interview was held over Skype with a panel. The questions were straightforward and relevant to the position. The interview allowed for me to ask any questions I had.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: After submitting a resume it can take Human Resources awhile to get back to you for an interview. I was contacted by the hiring manager and the interview was 1-1 with the hiring manager. Most times you may interview with the manager, clinical care leader, employee on that unit and a nurse educator.
Interview Questions:
What are the TOH values and mission?
What do you do if a patient falls?
What are the 3 clinical tactics?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: It took more than 3 months to hear back for the first interview after I submitted my application. Some of the questions were challenging but overall I would say it was a good experience and the people were lovely.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in a few years?

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Three people on the interview panel, manager, senior analyst and HR. The questions were largely behavioural and not many technical questions. Some had to do with writing project documentation, such as project timelines and BRD.
Interview Questions: Experience with SQL and other coding languages. Coding was not needed but an asset. Database skills are more useful in this situation but it may vary.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital
Interview Descriptions: difficult scenario based questions, group interviews, come prepared, draw on previous experiences to help answer your questions, if you dont know dont pretend to know, ask questions, ensure you study before the interview
Interview Questions: tell us about yourself

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview process. Heard back within 2 days. The interview was pleasant and met with the supervisor and one of the research team members. Seemed like the interview process differs based on the team that is hiring.
Interview Questions:
What are your professional goals
Do you have research experience

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It was a two-step telephonic interview, questions regarding background, skill set, how would you use those skills etc. Working under stressful situations, working independently, expectations at work, benefits. requirement of hardware and software
Interview Questions: How would you work within deadlines?

title: Contracting Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: One round of interviews that asked how a RFP goes and your experience with procurement.  There were also scenarios on how you would handle a certain situation and how it affects the organisation and the RFP process.
Interview Questions: What does the RFP evaluation look like?

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Being interviewed by more than one person can sometime throw an applicant off. No they were not being malicious. It's just the way jobs operate. They want to be sure to get the best answer possible.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work for us

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Nursing manager and clinical educator interviewed me. I got asked some questions regarding conduct with fellow colleagues, working as a team, etc. Then I got asked some general nursing questions (vitals, assessments). And then I got asked a few unit specific questions. The unit specific questions were centered around what types of patients and procedures were unique to that unit and the nursing work related to those specific challenges.
Interview Questions: Priority assessment with a post- operative patient.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital
Interview Descriptions:
Had a short (15 min) in-person screening interview with the Clinical Manager, followed by an in-person longer interview with Clinicians.

The interview with the Clinicians was quite short (less than half an hour). It seemed like they had already made up their minds before I walked in the door. They didn't really ask me behavioural questions, and only asked me a few questions about myself.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a very long process..from getting the pre-selection call, to passing a medical terminology test, data entry & Word, Excel, and a language test. Interview was standard - Supervisor of department & an educator, it lasted about an hour with mostly scenario based question. Verbal offer was given within a few days. Job offer e-mail took a little over week once references were checked.
Interview Questions: Explain a situation in your previous job where you had to take control over a situation. What did you do? How did your coworkers/management react? What was the outcome?

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: No interview, she seemed too busy and told me to go talk to the people working there. On the way out I stopped in and said I’d get back to her. Said yes and started the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON)
Interview Descriptions: arrived on time. dress semi-formal. lean forward during interview towards the interviewer. lokk at the interviewer when answering questions. talk clear. answer only questions that are asked. it was a 45 minutes interview.
Interview Questions:
Vision, mission of TOH 
core values of TOH and explain

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON)
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was done in 2 steps. The first one was a Phone screen and the second one was nn site face to face, behavioural questions and about 4 technical tests.
The second interview was with 2 technical leaders and the manager. They were very friendly to chat with me. It was about 1 hour and they did about 10 questions about my behaviour and 4 tests to verify my technical skills.
Interview Questions:
Have you worked in  a team?
What is a good leader for you?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied for external position online and dropped of resume in person to manager. Called manager one week later to check up, booked interview for that week. Received job offer a few weeks after interview.
Interview Questions: What are the 4 core values to TOH?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON)
Interview Descriptions:
The interviewers were very professional and friendly. I was well prepared for the types of questions they were going to ask. They got back quickly with relevant feedback. 

I appreciated that I knew who was on the panel prior to the interview. It made you feel comfortable when you met them.
Interview Questions: There questions were focused on fit within the environment. Since I didn't know the environment I felt it was best to answer what I liked about a culture.

title: Xrays ACC CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Interview took 15 minutes. The supervisor of the radiology department, and also the team leader of the department. They looked over my resume. They noticed that I was a waitress said that I could mulitask, but said yes. Then asked when I could start. I answered yesterday and got hired. Best interview ever. If
Interview Questions: If I could mulitask

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview first which was easy , then meeting with three people from different teams.
The position was very new to them and they weren't sure what kind of skills the candidate should have
Interview Questions: Education, technical questions and behavioral questions

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty seamless.  Standard questions and academic questions.  Most of the interview was speaking with various individuals of the laboratory and getting to know the research and the workplace environment.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Methodologists Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had been referred by one of my friends who is working there and then I got the interview. The interview was with the Director and one of the senior methologists. It was almost technical and it took about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions:
How do you manage an unclear problem?
What will be the challenges of this position?
What is p-value?
How do you document files?
There was a SAS quiz

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: 1hour interview between manager and clinical educator.                                     .
Interview Questions: What are 3 clinical tactics employed by TOH

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview process. General behavioral questions. Interviewers were very friendly. Some  easy to answer technical questions.  interview lasted less than 1 hour. Standard interview to find a fit for the role
Interview Questions: Standard interview to find a fit for the role

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I received an email to setup a face-to-face interview with a finance manager. 
Face-to-face interview involved meeting with a finance manager and finance director. 
Interview was roughly 1 hour in length.
Invited back for second interview with corporate controller, same manager and director, and additional director.
During second interview, received more questions around employee interactions and what I would do in certain situations.
Interview panel left the room and first interview manager and director came back and made a verbal offer to me. 
Received confirmation of offer by email from HR and hard-copy mailed to me a few days later.
Interview Questions:
How would selling a widget effect certain accounts from an accounting perspective (i.e., revenue, COGS, inventory)?
3 biggest strengths and weaknesses and why?
Describe a time you dealt with an unhelpful colleague? How did you resolve the issue?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ottawa Hospital (Ottawa, ON) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions:
- Submit a CV and cover letter to HR for any external posting
- Interview booked after posting is removed
- Interview with unit manager, Care Facilitator, and Nurse Educator for 15 minutes to 1 hour
- Find out if you got the position
Interview Questions: What is ERAS and how does it effect our patient care?
